review_title: A little goes a long way
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2024
review_body: This tea looks great, the leaves and the blossoms and all of the ingredients look top notch.  I was expecting a more floral flavor, but it was much more earthy.  Not bad, just not what I was expecting.  I do recommend to be mindful of the steeping time; I found that 3 min makes a good cup. Too long and it can get bitter.That being said, this is A LOT of tea.  The entire bag will go a long, long way and make you a lot of tea.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2024
review_body: As someone who struggles with winding down after a long day, I'm always on the lookout for natural remedies to promote relaxation and better sleep. First and foremost, the aroma of this tea is absolutely divine. The blend of lavender, chamomile, and linden blossom creates a soothing scent that instantly calms my senses and prepares me for a peaceful night's sleep. With each sip, I can feel the tension melting away, allowing me to fully unwind and relax. But it's not just about the aroma ‚Äì the ingredients in this tea are carefully selected to promote restful sleep. Valerian and passion flower work together to ease tension and quiet the mind, helping me drift off into a deep and rejuvenating slumber.

review_title: Good if you want a nighttime ritual!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2024
review_body: I don't think there is anything about this tea that is specifically tuned to relaxation, etc. except that it doesn't have caffein and has a nice floral bouquet. It only is calm and relaxing, IMHO, if it becomes part of a routine/ritual where you can otherwise take some time and enjoy the taste and aroma experience in the right mindset. In that case, it's more about the other things than the tea, but this certainly fits the bill. There may be less expensive options, but this is a good one.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
review_body: This is a nighttime tea with chamomile, lavender, linden blossom, valerian root, lemon balm, passion flower, and rose petals in it. As you can imagine, it has a floral scent/taste, which is very relaxing and soothing but might not be to everyone's taste. It is caffeine-free. It suggests on the back to use it with a filter bag, but I used it in a regular tea strainer with no issues. The leaves are large enough that I didn't get sediment in my tea.It is quite expensive but a large bag, considering you only need one heaped teaspoon for 8oz of water. There are an estimated 33 cups in the bag, so it is slightly less than a dollar a cup, but that's still more expensive than some other teas I've tried that come in at less than fifty cents per cup.The scent is quite strong and looks quite pretty, so if you don't want to drink this as tea, you could use it for potpourri. I liked it as tea but I think the lavender could be toned back slightly.

review_title: It works! Relaxes and helps sleep
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2024
review_body: I've been struggling with sleep issues for more than a year, often getting only 3-5 hours of sleep and taking hours to fall asleep. My nighttime routine has been inconsistent. My doctor prescribed several medications and I've tried many over-the-counter options like melatonin, zzzquil. I decided to establish a better sleep routine. Now, I shower, follow my skincare routine, have a cup of tea, and head to bed. I also use mood lighting and play relaxing music. After finishing the tea and lying down I fell asleep within 15 minutes. It also has a very pleasant taste. I‚Äôm happy with this product and going to order more.

review_title: Lovely loose leaf tea, strong ginger flavor
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
review_body: This is a new brand for me, and I couldn't be happier. The price is better than my usual brands, and you can buy small packets to try the flavor. I buy loose leaf tea, and always make ice tea, using the cold brew method. (put filter and water in pitcher, leave on counter for a couple hours, then refrigerate for 8-12 hours, or when it seems done) As you can see in the pictures, I have 2 pitchers going at once. The other pitcher has another tea from this manufacturer.This tea has a strong ginger taste, which probably is why it comes first in the name, lol! I'm used to ones that are peach first, then ginger, which isn't as strong. It's okay with me, but I'm glad I didn't add some fresh ginger pieces to it when it was brewing! I like to add frozen fruit to my tea when drinking it, to keep it cold, and add a little flavor.The first picture is of the dry tea before it is brewed, straight out of the packet. You can see big chunks of fruit in there, with other spices and tea. The aroma is magical.The second picture is the tea after it's been brewed. You can see the chunks have all expanded, letting out all of their goodness.  I haven't seen many other brands that have similar qualities. The third picture is of my two pitchers, both filled with Tiesta Tea, one being the Ginger Sweet Peach, the one on the right.Yes, I highly recommend this product.

review_title: Good herbal loose leaf tea, bulk size lasts a long time
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2024
review_body: Costco used to sell this tea as an immunity tea.  My mom is obsessed with it and drinks it religiously anytime she feels under the weather or in general during flu season.  Given the ingredients list, it is probably a good source of vitamin C and antioxidants.  It is a loose leaf tea that definitely benefits from having a fine-mesh tea strainer.  It is also really strong and quite tart, but then again so is rose hip tea.  I like that it is non-caffeinated and in bulk, so you can decide how much you want to brew.  Each bag lasts a long time so we only reorder it a couple times a year.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2024
review_body: I am very happy with this tea sampler!  The samples are very generous.  You can easily get 5+ cups from each sample.  I use a tea ball and make my cup a bit stronger, so there is PLENTY in each pouch.The flavors are very rich and deep.  The aroma is amazing.  This is probably the best tea I've had.  I got the 8-pouch sample pack, and am very pleased with the variety.  I'm also happy that there is no mint in the samples.  I don't care for mint at all.If you like good tea with lots of flavor, do yourself a solid and get this.

brand: California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried Above-Ground Part Glycerite 4 oz
name: California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried Above-Ground Part Glycerite 4 oz
description: The California poppy is the state flower of California, a tender perennial plant bearing blue-green leaves and 2 to 4 inch (5 to 10 cm) wide flowers that open in bright sun and close on cloudy days and at night. The California poppy is considered an ancient plant whose origins are not entirely known. Native Americans in California prized them as a source of food and for the oil that could be extracted from the plant. Eschscholzia californica was the first named member of the genus Eschscholzia, which was named by the German botanist Adelbert von Chamisso after the Baltic German botanist Johann Friedrich von Eschscholtz, his friend and colleague on Otto von Kotzebue‚Äôs scientific expedition to California and the greater Pacific in mid-1810s aboard the Russian ship Rurik.
features: California Poppy Glycerite contains ONLY natural ingredients! Alcohol Free! Gluten Free! Non-GMO! | High Quality California Poppy NON-Alcohol liquid extract - we use classic conventional methods of extraction! We meticulously produce our extracts according to precise standards where each herb is extracted according to the distinct characteristic of each plant! | The highest quality California Poppy Glycerin based liquid extract made with love for plants and respect for Nature! | We strictly use Only Certified or ethically sourced wild harvested raw material, vegetable palm glycerin and crystal clear artesian purified water! Really the BEST California Poppy herbal glycerite on market!

I say this because it would be nice to just invest in the 64oz, so long as shelf life doesn‚Äôt play a roll in keeping kava long term.

name: California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried Above-Ground Part Glycerite 4 oz
description: The California poppy is the state flower of California, a tender perennial plant bearing blue-green leaves and 2 to 4 inch (5 to 10 cm) wide flowers that open in bright sun and close on cloudy days and at night. The California poppy is considered an ancient plant whose origins are not entirely known. Native Americans in California prized them as a source of food and for the oil that could be extracted from the plant. Eschscholzia californica was the first named member of the genus Eschscholzia, which was named by the German botanist Adelbert von Chamisso after the Baltic German botanist Johann Friedrich von Eschscholtz, his friend and colleague on Otto von Kotzebue‚Äôs scientific expedition to California and the greater Pacific in mid-1810s aboard the Russian ship Rurik.
features: California Poppy Glycerite contains ONLY natural ingredients! Alcohol Free! Gluten Free! Non-GMO! | High Quality California Poppy NON-Alcohol liquid extract - we use classic conventional methods of extraction! We meticulously produce our extracts according to precise standards where each herb is extracted according to the distinct characteristic of each plant! | The highest quality California Poppy Glycerin based liquid extract made with love for plants and respect for Nature! | We strictly use Only Certified or ethically sourced wild harvested raw material, vegetable palm glycerin and crystal clear artesian purified water! Really the BEST California Poppy herbal glycerite on market!

review_title: Helps me to relax and sleep
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2023
review_body: I love this product.  I saw that some people didn‚Äôt find it effective and/or it didn‚Äôt taste great. I almost didn‚Äôt buy it but decided to give it a try. Now I drink it nightly to help me relax and drift off to sleep. I also take it with me traveling and it has been really helpful in that situation as well. I usually combine with another sleepytime tea from the supermarket that is chamomile vanilla. It‚Äôs part of my overall ritual of sleep hygiene including sleep music, a hot bath/shower and reading. It is a little pricey but well worth it in my opinion. I have tried chamomile tea alone and that is not as effective. You get what you pay for type of thing.

review_title: Product amazing, Amazon shipping crushed it
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021
review_body: I am a huge fan of Rishi. They source THE BEST from around the world. This chamomile brews THE MOST AMAZING and satisfying elixir. I noticed the Egyptian source was replaced with another region but the quality remains superb. Unfortunately, Amazon does not understand the care required to protect the dried whole flowers during delivery and they put it in a plastic sleeve without even the slightest cushion. The result was a badly crushed product. Rishi packs their direct orders properly so Amazon needs to catch up in this area Most people wouldn't care but if I wanted dust, I would have ordered it. I ordered whole flowers and now I have to put them in paper filters to prevent the crushed bits from ending up in my cup...I don't like the taste of paper, I'm spoiled, I know. I tried my microperforated filter but it wasn't enough. But it doesn't stop me from enjoying this Superior product. I just might order direct next time if Amazon can't correct their poor handling. I will say in Amazon's defense they made it right when I complained about my product showing up the way it did. Amazon always makes it right for me. You can't lose on Rishi either way.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2024
review_body: I have been drinking tea for several decades and I went to a small coffee shop in a small town and was blown away by there herbal tea. I asked what it was and they told me, so I ordered my own and my friend blueberry (I like the cinnamon plum) and I can't get enough of it! The longer you let it sit and brew the better! I usually make my tea, then pour hot water over the tea and let it sit for hours then come back and add water to it and I will get 30-40oz out of about 1/4 cup of loose leaf tea. YUMMY!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
review_body: I wanted to try loose leaf tea and bought this flavor to replace the prepackaged Honey Vanilla Chamomile I usually buy. But this is even better! Open opening the package, immediately you can smell the freshness of the leaves. As this was my first time using loose leaf tea, it was fun just gently inhaling the scent, taking a moment to identify and appreciate each of the ingredients.Usually I can't wait for the bags to steep but this time I gave the leaves the appropriate amount of time, the recommended 4 minutes, excited to experience each flavor. While my cup usually has a generous helping of sugar and milk, this time I only added a splash to cool it down, and a small teaspoon. It did not disappoint. The flavors came together beautifully, without the usual bitterness that requires all the sugar to make it enjoyable for me. This time, I actually enjoyed the flavor of the tea itself, savoring each sip.Not only was the sup itself wonderful, but the packaging is aesthetically pleasing. Tightly pressed so no air gets inside keeping leaves fresh.The seller also included a complimentary sample of another flavor. I anticipate getting at least 3 or 4 cups from the sample alone!I highly recommend this tea, this seller, and will definitely be purchasing again.Thank you so much!EDIT- Even though the bag doesnt look like much at first, it goes a long way!We've had this bag for 2 weeks now, and had probably 10 cups worth.  We haven't even gone through a quarter of it. We used to have to use two bags of the pre bagged tea for each cup, so even though there were 20 bags, we would only get 10 cups out of it, and it's about $5 at our local store. This loose leaf not only taste so much better but it you end up getting more bang for your buck!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2022
review_body: I bought this for my husband who loves his nightly tea. I remember he loved apple chai and decided to surprise him one evening with something different. My whole kitchen smelled amazing brewing it and when I presented it to my husband he was nothing but complementary. He said it was so full of flavor and 1000 times better than Starbucks! I will definitely be ordering again.

brand: Yogi Tea Soothing Caramel Bedtime Tea - 16 Tea Bags per Pack (4 Packs) - Calming Sleep Tea - Supports Good Sleep - Includes Chamomile Flower, Rooibos Leaf, Roasted Chicory Root & More
name: Yogi Tea Soothing Caramel Bedtime Tea - 16 Tea Bags per Pack (4 Packs) - Calming Sleep Tea - Supports Good Sleep - Includes Chamomile Flower, Rooibos Leaf, Roasted Chicory Root & More
features: Organic Sleep Tea: Yogi Soothing Caramel Bedtime tea is purposefully blended with Chamomile Flower, Skullcap, and L-Theanine to support relaxation and good sleep | Delicious Calming Tea: Naturally sweet Rooibos combines with notes of Vanilla and Caramel for a delicious and warming tea; unwind from the day with a comforting cup | Tea Bag Instructions: Bring water to boiling and steep the tea bag for 7 minutes; for a stronger tea, use 2 tea bags; drink before bedtime | Premium Tea Ingredients: This Yogi tea is vegan and NON-GMO, so you can be sure you're getting the best in every cup | Uniquely Yogi: We believe in using the highest quality spices and botanicals, complementing them with intriguing, delightful flavors, qualities that make all of our teas uniquely Yogi
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2023
review_body: I recently discovered the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea, and it has quickly become my go-to drink for a serene and cozy evening routine. This tea has truly transformed my bedtime experience, and I couldn't be more delighted with its comforting flavors and soothing effects.From the moment you open the package, the aromatic notes of caramel fill the air, instantly creating a sense of warmth and relaxation. The delightful scent alone sets the stage for a peaceful and tranquil evening.The taste of this tea is simply divine. The caramel flavor is perfectly balanced, not overpowering, and it adds a delightful touch of sweetness to each sip. It's like indulging in a guilt-free treat that helps me unwind after a long day.What makes the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea truly special is its blend of herbs and botanicals. Infused with chamomile, roasted dandelion, and licorice root, this blend works harmoniously to calm the mind and relax the body. With every sip, I can feel the stress and tension melt away, paving the way for a restful night's sleep.Another aspect I appreciate about this tea is its commitment to using high-quality, organic ingredients. As someone who values natural and wholesome products, it brings me peace of mind knowing that I am nourishing my body with a tea that is free from artificial additives and pesticides.The tea bags are individually wrapped, ensuring optimal freshness and convenience. I appreciate the thoughtfulness that goes into each detail of the packaging, making it easy to enjoy a cup of bliss whenever the mood strikes.Whether you're winding down after a hectic day or simply craving a moment of tranquility, the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea is a true indulgence for the senses. It has become an integral part of my evening ritual, helping me relax, unwind, and drift into a deep, rejuvenating sleep.If you're seeking a delicious and comforting tea that promotes serenity and restfulness, I wholeheartedly recommend the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea. Treat yourself to this delightful blend and discover the blissful sip of serenity it brings to your bedtime routine.

review_title: Yep.  It works!  Knocked me right out.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
review_body: This is my second review;  I fixed a cup up and let it steep for ten minutes. I drank it at 10:00 PM.  It totally destresses/slows down your brain, relaxes your muscles and you fall asleep faster.  But getting up in the morning can be a challenge.  I had to take two naps the next day.  I'm in the over 65 age group and just had surgery so I am in recovery phase, but this was crazy.  I was actually wobbly on my feet!  I was groggy till 3:45 PM.  The next time I used it I REMOVED the tea bag after 3 minutes.  I was more alert the next morning.  You do have to pay attention to just how strong you want this tea.  Don't underestimate its power to work!  My daughter was sleepy to 3:30 the next day and her best friend said it knocked her out and she slept like a rock until nearly noon the next day. Here's the list of ingredients:Yogi Soothing Caramel Bedtime tea contains the following ingredients: Organic Chamomile Flower, Organic Rooibos Leaf**, Organic Roasted Chicory Root, Organic Skullcap Leaf, Organic Nutmeg Kernel, Organic Caramel Flavor, Organic Vanilla Flavor, Organic Cinnamon Bark, Organic Stevia Leaf, Organic Cardamom Pod, Organic California Poppy Plant, Organic Ginger Root, Organic Clove Bud, L-Theanine Suntheanine, Organic Black Pepper, Organic Cinnamon Bark Oil, Organic Cardamom Seed Oil, Organic Ginger Root Oil.

This delightful tea gets its sweet fruit-and-honey flavor from tiny organic elderflowers that grow naturally in Macedonia's secluded mountain meadows. Elderflowers have been used for centuries in Macedonia to help reduce stress. Contains no sugar, artificial colors, artificial flavors or preservatives.
features: A delicate floral tea. | Contains no sugar, artificial colors, artificial flavors or preservatives | 100% Certified USDA Organic, 100% Caffeine Free, 100% Gluten Free, 100% Calorie Free, 100% Sugar Free, 100% Good for You | 1 box containing 20 tea bags | Ingredients: Organic Elderflowers
review_title: Pleasant Herbal Taste & Good for Inflammatory Coughing Caused by Asthma
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020
review_body: Somewhere I read that thyme tea might be beneficial for congestion and coughing spells.  I am asthmatic and get bouts of bronchial coughing spells that can be a nuisance and hard to control at times. My asthma is caused by inflammation to the airways and thyme is touted as possibly being beneficial for inflammation and soothing a throat irritated by coughing. So, hey, anything that might help I'll at least give it a try.  It does have a pleasant herbal taste, at least in my opinion, and is soothing on my throat. Since it is an herbal tea I can drink it anytime of day or even in the evening and not have to worry about caffeine disturbing my sleep. I can usually get two cups of tea from one teabag so for my personal use it lasts me awhile. I purchased this thyme tea online because I could not find it in any of my local stores. I would purchase it again as it would be good for allergy season as well when I get the sneezing and coughing spells from allergen irritants. Plus it just makes a nice warm soothing nightcap too.I have low blood pressure and am not on medication so I don't worry too much about  the thyme tea raising my blood pressure but those on blood pressure medication might want to take caution. Always, check with your doctor first when in doubt even about herbal products as sometimes they can interfere with prescription meds.

brand: Good Nature Organic Elderflower Tea, 1.07 Ounce
name: Good Nature Organic Elderflower Tea, 1.07 Ounce
description: Good Nature Organic Elderflower Tea is a stress-relieving herbal tea blend. This delightful tea gets its sweet fruit-and-honey flavor from tiny organic elderflowers that grow naturally in Macedonia's secluded mountain meadows. Elderflowers have been used for centuries in Macedonia to help reduce stress. Contains no sugar, artificial colors, artificial flavors or preservatives.
features: A delicate floral tea. | Contains no sugar, artificial colors, artificial flavors or preservatives | 100% Certified USDA Organic, 100% Caffeine Free, 100% Gluten Free, 100% Calorie Free, 100% Sugar Free, 100% Good for You | 1 box containing 20 tea bags | Ingredients: Organic Elderflowers
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2018
review_body: This tea worked miracles for me.  I am not exaggerating one bit.I'm 71 years old with lots of allergies - to foods and environmental vegetation.In July there was a huge wildfire in the mountains near us.  I felt like I was hit with a ton of bricks.  The wildfire smoke wreaked havoc on my body.  My face swelled up badly.  I had difficulty breathing.  My blood pressure went up 21 points and stayed that way for 6 weeks.  I went to my primary care doctor and urgent care during this time.  I was a mess.Then I learned that the fine particulate matter from wildfire smoke settles in the lungs, gets into the bloodstream and can cross the blood-brain barrier.  I was on high doses of prednisone for 6 weeks.  I didn't get better.I finally learned that thyme tea is an anti-inflammatory. So, I bought some from Amazon.  I flavored it with cinnamon, ginger, a pinch of cloves and a little honey.  It tasted good.  After just half a cup, I started to feel better - finally.  After an hour, I was starting to feel 'healthy'.Now, after 3 days, my neighbors and friends are telling me that the swelling on my face is getting better.  When it's so noticeable that even casual neighbors are noticing the difference, you know something good is happening.  And, I just checked my blood pressure.  It's down by 15 points.This tea is really healing me.  And, a friend who is a chef dropped by and I asked him to taste the tea.  After 3 sips, he said that the tightness he had in his chest went away.  I wasn't even aware that he was having chest problems.  He said he hasn't been bothered by asthma in a long time, but that day his chest felt tight.  The tea helped him to feel better.These are true stories.  Take it for what you will.  I just know that I'm happy with the effects this tea has had on my health.

review_body: This tea has a light, yet spicy, flavor.  I have really been enjoying it.  It was recommended to me as being good for healing the gut, and while I am unclear on whether or not it is making a difference in my health, I will continue to use it just because I like it so much.  And it can't hurt, right? I like that it has no artificial colors, no sugar, no artificial flavors or preservatives, and is 100% certified USDA organic, 100% caffeine free and 100% gluten free.  All good stuff, and no bad stuff!  The packaging is lovely, nice and natural looking.  It comes at a great price too.  Win-win all around.  My new favorite tea, and I will continue to order it.

review_body: I really wanted this to be a warming, soothing, silky latte. Unfortunately, it isn't.I love my turmeric and ashwagandha, I think they work wonders and I've taken them in various forms. I also love black pepper and have it on all my dinnersThis latte is just undrinkable, I have no idea why it's has as many stars as it does. I've just followed the instructions and sat down to what I thought would be a soothing warm cuppa only to have the roof of my mouth taken off by the sheer black pepper content. It renders this drink completely undrinkable. It's ten minutes later and my mouth is still on fire.What a waste of money, yuk.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024
review_body: I love the choice of ingredients and the fact that it‚Äôs certified organic too. It‚Äôs fairly easy to take (2 dropperfuls once to three times a day) but it‚Äôs hard for me to get a ‚Äúfull‚Äù dropper.  It fills up about 3/4 of the way no matter how I angle the bottle and position the dropper.  And there‚Äôs no line or indicator to show how full it needs to be.  However, since they say you can take it up to 3x a day I guess you don‚Äôt have to be too cautious about overdosing.  The taste is also a little strong for me personally ‚Äî the thyme really is prominent in this.  I am used to herbal supplements and normally don‚Äôt have any issues with weird concoctions but with this one I‚Äôd have to get used to it.  I was able to do one dropper of it without mixing into anything but I think I‚Äôll try hiding it in a tart juice, but it‚Äôs such a strange combination of flavors I‚Äôm not sure I could stand drinking it in a full cup of juice.  In a pinch I would use this but I think I‚Äôd prefer a pill or just a simple elderberry gummy instead.  Just my preference anyway.  Otherwise the product itself is clean and seems to be an excellent way to boost your immune system when necessary.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024
review_body: This item is a 30ml amber bottle of organic herb tincture that is plant based and formulated to provide immunity support. The bottle includes an eye dropper cap that is used to deliver the recommended 2 dropper full of the liquid. The ingredients includes extracts of echinacea, elderberry, thyme, sage, yarrow, and lemon balm in a proprietary combination. The claim is that this tincture will support a healthy immune system and provide a defense against seasonal threats that can make you ill, per the product description. I'm familiar with all the ingredients, but feel that there are minerals and vitamins that should be added to the mix to boost immunity. The liquid tastes quite bad so I recommend adding the 2 dropper full to some juice. I appreciate that it's made in the USA. I find the price point for 20 days supply to be rather steep. Overall, it's not a bad tincture to add to your daily supplement regiment, but it's not something I will continue to use given I have other more cost effective immunity support supplements.

Each herb is meticulously selected for its proven ability to promote relaxation and encourage deep, restful sleep, making it perfect for those moments when you feel wired-but-tired. | EASY TO ENJOY: Whether you‚Äôre at home, work, or on the go, tinctures effortlessly integrate into your day, allowing you to enjoy the benefits of Organic Sleep Better without fuss. review_title: Not sure how many benefits it gives but seems fine
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
review_body: Not entirely sure how great of a benefit one gets from the Qat listed here instead of the actual qat used in places like Yemen, but this stuff does not have any acute effects that you will notice immediately. Most importantly, if you're very sensitive to taste, this is definitely one of those "acquired tastes" products, but I generally liked it and thought it was pleasant enough after the initial use. Might have benefits over time, but hard to tell.
